pageContext.description: One corner of edge is blunted by recent fall.  Decorated below stop with punched lines which surround a slightly raised shield. On the sides are incised lines and punched dots. Excellent condition.  Where found this specimen was a mass of corroded metal, nearly a foot long. Mr. Roberts cleaned this off gradually with soda and water.
pageContext.patina: Green, with dull golden bronze showing.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,1925,John Henry Roberts,Ash House, Prees, Shropshire,(Formerly of Preeswood Farm),drawn at his house by Lily F. Chitty, 26th July 1925
pageContext.site: England,Shropshire,Prees,Preeswood Farm (on "the Moors"),Approx. 6 ft. deep in running sand found whilst draining,1875 (about),3/4 ESE of Prees Church; 1/3 mile SW of Preeswood Farm,exact spot known and inserted on map 26.2.25
pageContext.toSearch: Prees Wood, Prees, Whitchurch, Shropshire Sy13, UK
pageContext.gridRef: 6 inch O.S. Shropshire Sheet XV NW
pageContext.remarks: Section below stop. In the original this was shown nearer to stop. This has been redrawn showing section nearer to butt end. This account for difference in thickness of septum at same spot on longitudinal section.,Cf. Middlesex Sion Reach (Isleworth) and Irish.
